feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 25 to 40 mm/h expected from Wednesday morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 140 mm of rain with downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 200 mm of rain with localised downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible, with largest accumulations likely west of Whakatane. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Warning period extended.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain and accumulations may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Watch has been decreased to Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 180 mm of rain, especially about higher ground with localised downpours 25 to 40 mm/h possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Rainfall totals increased and Warning period extended.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with localised downpours of 25 to 40mm possible. Accumulations may approach warning criteria in some locations. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain with localised downpours possible. Isolated areas may exceed warning criteria, especially in downpours. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: High.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 200 mm of rain near the Divide and 100 to 120 mm within 15 km east of the Divide. Intensities of 20 to 25 mm/h. Freezing level 3000 metres. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been decreased to Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: North to northwest winds may approach severe gale, mostly about the High Country, but also the Plains close to the foothill this afternoon or early evening. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 180 to 200 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, with intensities of 25 to 30 mm/h possible this morning and afternoon. Note, some places near the coast south of Harihari may accumulate up to 100 mm during the same period. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Upgraded to Warning (Orange).

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 60 to 80 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, with intensities of 10 to 20 mm/h possible this morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: The chance of upgrade for this Orange Warning has been decreased to Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
